lines: Sorry, you're still too young for this experience.  Come back later.
Sorry, you're too old for this experience.

You are sitting in the school library, bored to death. It is a warm spring day and the sun is streaming through the windows, lighting up a square area on the desk in front of you. You are wishing for a distraction to take you away from
the research project you are SUPPOSED to be doing.

Suddenly, a terrific-looking girl in a red miniskirt and T-shirt sits in the study area directly across from you. She crosses her legs under her, settles into her seat and begins work. You can smell her perfume from where you are sitting.
Trying to look as intelligent as possible, you start writing furiously, hoping to attract her attention. Her eyes remain glued to her own work.
You ask her if she knows what time it is.
She looks up for a brief moment, shakes her head back and forth, and puts her head down. You notice a rather large watch on her left wrist.

You're not one who gives up easily. About ten minutes pass. She gets up from her seat and walks toward the back of the library. You notice that she has left her purse and some of her books behind. She's probably just going to the ladies'
The sun is warm and relaxing. You wish she would come back soon.

You feel a soft hand encircle your shoulder and hear someone whisper, "What are you doing YOUR project on,  'Dreaming?'" The smell of perfume stirs you from your doze. You try to think of something clever to say, hoping to use this
as an opportunity to get her phone number.

You say, "When you came in I thought you were too beautiful to be real, so I went to sleep, hoping I would meet you in my dreams." NOTE: PLAYERS WHO WANT TO CONTINUE MAY TAKE A FEW SECONDS TO GAG, IF NECESSARY, BEFORE PROCEEDING.
You look up...MRS. ESCHBACH, the LIBRARIAN?! Oh, NO! She says, "I haven't been spoken to like that in ages. You're so sweet. Now GET BACK TO WORK!" She waddles off.
The girl comes back, picks up her things, and leaves.
Later that evening, you leaf through your papers and discover a note.

The note says: "Sat with you in the library today. Can't you think of anything more interesting to say than 'Do you know what time it is?' If you can, why don't you give me a call and SAY it? 555-9854--Pam"
You call, but the line seems to be constantly busy.
Finally, you hear the line ringing.
Someone picks up the phone..."Hello, Thrift City Sleep Shop. Can I help you?"
Your heart sinks, but you give it one last, futile try. "Is Pam there?"
You introduce yourself and tell her that she has been on your mind all day.
She only goes for the people who are absolutely the coolest. Your Social status sphere suggests that you have the skills to impress her. Your first date with her is this Saturday.
Your desire to go through with this risk means that you are not that concerned about your steady girl friend. She discovers that you are cheating on her and breaks your steady relationship.
Your Social status sphere suggests that you don't have the skills to impress this type of girl. She gives you the brush off over the phone, and you never see her again.
